claim: No significant difference in the frequency of mental disorders was found between SH+ and ETAU at 12 months (RR=0.841; p=0.659)
SH+ was associated with improvements at 12 months in psychological distress (p=0.004), depressive symptoms (p=0.011) and wellbeing (p=0.001)
place: Improvement in psychological distress (GHQ-12 score) at 12 months

claim: In the per protocol population (attending at least 3 sessions), SH+ showed no significant reduction in mental disorders compared to ETAU (RR=0.528; p=0.230)
ADHD patients more often reported suicidal ideation (46.0% vs. 5.9%; p < 0.001) compared to controls
ADHD patients had significantly higher suicide rates than controls, with a standardized mortality ratio of 4.83 (95% CI: 1.14-20.46; p < 0.05)
ADHD patients had higher scores for all negative affective temperaments compared to controls, with significant differences on all scales administered except for TEMPS-A Hyperthymia (p < 0.001)
place: TEMPS-A Depression scores were higher in ADHD patients (11.35 ± 3.81) compared to controls (6.22 ± 2.65)

claim: Supervisor's support has a significant positive relationship with organizational support (β=.60, p<.01)

The SUD (Subjective Units of Disturbance) scores showed significant reduction between first and final sessions (p < 0.05)

place: Correlation between physical fitness and neural activity in left superior parietal lobule (Peak2 in Table 3)

claim: Whole-brain analysis of group by WM load revealed reduced neural activity in six frontoparietal clusters at medium and high WM loads in MDD patients compared to healthy controls (p<0.05)

place: Physical self-efficacy scores comparison between HW and OW girls

Adolescents described being alone as loneliness less often than expected compared to adults who described being alone as loneliness more often than expected (χ2(1, N=1066)=8.51, p=0.004)
Adolescents described being alone as negative more often than expected compared to adults who described being alone as negative less often than expected (χ2(1, N=1066)=8.63, p=0.003)

Being female (OR=1.49, p=0.015) and higher age (OR=1.10, p=0.049) were associated with describing being alone as loneliness in the adolescent sample, while lower age (OR=0.971, p<0.001) was associated with describing being alone as loneliness in the adult sample

There is a statistically significant positive relationship between emotional awareness and academic performance, with students who have better academic performance showing higher scores in differentiating emotions, attending to others' emotions, and analyzing their own emotions
place: The correlation between attending to others' emotions and academic performance (r=.180, p<.001)

claim: Students who failed the previous academic year obtained significantly lower scores in emotional awareness factors and happiness, and higher scores in sadness and anger
place: Students who failed the previous year scored significantly lower on attending to others' emotions (M=2.45) compared to those who passed (M=2.60)

claim: Emotional variables (attending to others' emotions, analyzing own emotions, differentiating emotions, verbal communication, and happiness) significantly predict academic performance, explaining 6.5% of the variance
place: Attending to others' emotions predicting academic performance (β=.120, p=.000)

place: The meta-analysis finding of increased mortality with colloids vs crystalloids, with a 4% absolute increase in risk of death

claim: Their summary table lists four trials with a concealment of 3. We assume that these are the four trials in question. Three of these trials compared colloid with hypertonic saline and account for 59 deaths (78%) between colloids and crystalloid.

Preliminary data from an initial uncontrolled trial evaluating RESTORE in frontline healthcare workers is highly promising, with 100% of individuals who have completed the intervention experiencing a reliable improvement on at least 1 of the 3 measures.

Networks trained with stratified normalization significantly outperformed standard batch normalization, reaching a classification accuracy of 91.6% for two emotion categories (positive and negative) and 79.6% for three categories (positive, neutral, negative)
The statistical results revealed a significant effect of the labeling method (F(1, 168) = 97.7, p < 0.001, η²p = 0.368), indicating better performance in binary vs ternary classification
A strong effect of the normalization method was found (F(1, 168) = 33.8, p < 0.001, η²p = 0.17), confirming that stratified normalization is more efficient than batch normalization

Only 6% of Oregon psychiatrists would be very confident after a single consultation in determining mental competency for assisted suicide, while 54% would be very confident and 41% would be somewhat confident after a long-term relationship with the patient.
Only 3% of respondents agreed that a request for assisted suicide from a terminally ill patient was prima facie evidence of a mental disorder.
27% of the psychiatrists opposed to physician-assisted suicide would nevertheless consider this option for themselves
The Palestinian context-specific trauma scale (PCSTS) showed a stable five-factor structure with good fit indices (GFI=.98, CFI=.96, NFI=.97, RFI=.95, RMSEA=.04, IFI=.96)
Significant differences in traumatic symptoms were found between males and females (t=9.15, p<.01), with males showing higher levels of trauma
Urban residents reported significantly higher trauma symptoms compared to rural residents (t=8.43, p<.01)

Secondary psychopathy was negatively associated with trait emotional intelligence (β = -.33, t = -4.09, p < .001)

The genotyped functional protein-altering variation yields a heritability estimate of 17.4% (s.e. 1.7%) based on a liability model.
The most strongly associated SNP was a missense variant located in PLXNB2 at 22q13 (rs28379706, c.A952G, p.K318E; P_CC < 1.31×10^-5, beta = -0.04±0.009, odds ratio = 0.76 (0.69-0.83))

For variants within the lowest frequency class (MAF < 0.01), there were significantly fewer rare alleles associated with high intelligence than would be expected (I/D_obs = 8.000, I/D_exp = 32.159, Z-score = -2.67, P_I/D = 0.008)

place: The number of patients waiting less than 2 weeks for assessment increased under optimal conditions
